key_title: Key to the species of Gleichenia

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the families of ferns and allied plants
Key to the genera of Gleicheniaceae

source.author: Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta)
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Entwisle, T.J. (1994). Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta). In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Pinnules flat or with slightly recurved margins; sporangia 2–4 per sorus, not hidden by recurved pinnule margin; pinna-rachis without scales on undersurface
Pinnules pouched; sporangia 2 (rarely 3) per sorus, partially or wholly obscured by strongly recurved pinnule margin; pinna-rachis sparsely to densely covered with scales on undersurface
Lateral axes with abundant bundles of red-brown bristles; undersurface of pinnae pale green
Lateral axes glabrous or nearly so; undersurface of pinnae usually glaucous
